raw_text:
Baby becomes new Oscar favourite
 
 Clint Eastwood's boxing drama Million Dollar Baby has become the new favourite to win best picture at the Oscars on Sunday.
 
 According to pundits, the film has overtaken previous favourite The Aviator, with Eastwood also tipped to take the best director award. Its star Hilary Swank is favourite to win best actress while Jamie Foxx is tipped to win best actor for Ray. Million Dollar Baby has seven nominations while The Aviator has 11. The Aviator has scored a best director nomination for Martin Scorsese, who has never won an Oscar, while stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Cate Blanchett are both nominated for acting Oscars.
 
 "If you look at the Oscars race, The Aviator should be ahead," said awards pundit Tom O'Neil. "It is the most nominated film, and the most nominated movie has won best picture 18 times out of the last 20 years. "But the reality is Million Dollar Baby is the dark horse. People feel emotionally about it and Clint is a beloved Hollywood chum of the Academy voters," he said. Anne Thompson of the Hollywood Reporter said that Million Dollar Baby was "heart-wrenching". "It's very emotional, it even makes grown men cry," she said. "The Aviator is a gorgeous movie, but it's colder."
 
 In the acting categories, Foxx is regarded as almost unbeatable for his performance as Ray Charles in Ray. "The performance is based on a real person who was a showbusiness hero with a handicap, who recently died," O'Neil said. "He has unstoppable momentum among the voters." Hilary Swank is the favourite to win best actress for the second time in six years. She previously won in 1999 for her performance in Boys Don't Cry. In the supporting categories, Cate Blanchett is tipped to win for her performance as Katharine Hepburn in The Aviator, while Morgan Freeman is favourite to take home his first ever Oscar, for Million Dollar Baby. The Oscars will take place at Hollywood's Kodak Theatre on 27 February.

Eastwood and Swank are also favored to win best director and best actress respectively. Foxx is almost unbeatable in the best actor category for Ray. Million Dollar Baby has seven nominations while The Aviator has 11.
gemma2:2b: Million Dollar Baby has become the new favorite for Best Picture at the Oscars.  The film's emotional storyline and Clint Eastwood's directorial status have propelled it to this position. Hilary Swank is favored for Best Actress, while Jamie Foxx is considered almost unbeatable in his role as Ray Charles. The Aviator also received many nominations but lags behind in the race.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A new Hollywood sensation has captured the hearts of critics and audiences alike: "The Million Dollar Baby", a boxing drama starring Clint Eastwood as Ray Charles and Hilary Swank as Ray, with Jamie Foxx's performance receiving critical acclaim. The film has won best picture at the Oscars this year, potentially overtaking previous favorites such as "The Aviator". Stars like O'Neil, Thompson, and O'Connor have praised the emotional impact of Million Dollar Baby. However, Foxx remains a favorite due to his performance as Ray Charles in "Ray", and Swank's second nomination for acting.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Clint Eastwood's boxing drama "Million Dollar Baby" has become the new favorite to win Best Picture and Best Director Oscars, overtaking The Aviator in nominations. While The Aviator is leading overall with more wins, critics believe "Million Dollar Baby" is favored due to its emotional impact and connections to Academy voters. Hilary Swank is also a strong contender for best actress nomination.
qwen2.5:3b: Clint Eastwood’s Million Dollar Baby has become the new favorite to win best picture at this year's Oscars, overtaking previous frontrunner The Aviator. The film has seven nominations compared to The Aviator's eleven, though Martin Scorsese is nominated for best director with Leonardo DiCaprio and Cate Blanchett also receiving acting Oscar nods. Critics suggest Million Dollar Baby's emotional appeal could tip the scales in its favor over The Aviator. Hilary Swank is expected to win her second best actress award, while Jamie Foxx is favored to take home his first for Ray. Morgan Freeman is predicted to win supporting actor honors for Million Dollar Baby.

The film has been tipped by punitive media members to triumph in the best director category for Martin Scorsese and stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Angelina Jolie in lead roles. In other categories, Anne Thompson of Hollywood Reporter and Ann Thompson of the Hollywood Reporter have picked Foxx as a likely winner for his performance in Ray Charles' biopic Ray, while Hilary Swank is favored to win best actress for her performance in Clint Eastwood's boxing drama. The acting categories are dominated by Clint Eastwood, with Hilary Swank, Jamie Foxx, and Morgan Freeman all listed as contenders. Million Dollar Baby has four nominations in the supporting categories, where Cathe Blanchett is tipped to win for her performance in Eastwood's film while Morgan Freeman is also listed among the nominees. The Academy Awards will take place at Hollywood's Kodak Theatre on Sunday evening, and punitive media members have declared that Million Dollar Baby has a strong chance of taking home an award.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced the nominees for Best Picture and Best Director at its annual Governors Awards on Tuesday, with Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby taking the lead in both categories. The film has been nominated for a record-breaking 11 Oscars, including four for Best Picture, five for Best Director, and six for Best Actor (Hilary Swank), Best Actress (Jamie Foxx), and Best Supporting Actor (Martin Scorsese). Million Dollar Baby is now the favorite to win best picture and best director, with several other highly-regarded films also nominated in key categories.
phi:2.7b: Clint Eastwood's "Million Dollar Baby" has become the new favourite to win Best Picture at the Oscars, with Eastwood tipped to win Best Director. Other contenders include "The Aviator" and "Ray." Hilary Swank is favourite for Best Actress while Jamie Foxx is tipped to take home an acting Oscar for his role as Ray Charles in "Ray". The film has seven nominations, compared to "The Aviator's" eleven. Martin Scorsese has been nominated for Best Director with "The Aviator," but he never won an Oscar. Leonardo DiCaprio and Cate Blanchett are both nominated for acting Oscars. Tom O'Neil predicts that "Million Dollar Baby" will take the top prize, as people feel emotionally about it. Anne Thompson thinks "Million Dollar Baby" is heart-wrenching and a dark horse in the race. Hilary Swank's performance in "Boys Don't Cry" in 1999 is seen as unbeatable in the acting categories. Jamie Foxx's portrayal of Ray Charles in "Ray" is also considered unstoppable among voters, with Ray being based on a real person who was a showbusiness hero with a handicap. Cate Blanchett and Morgan Freeman are both favourite to win their first Oscars for "The Aviator" and "Million Dollar Baby" respectively. The Oscars will take place at the Kodak Theatre in Hollywood on 27 February.
